channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024110282
item.description:
Report E-2024110282

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T00:59:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-16
  • City: London
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 24069
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver stopped at rest stop and found trailer leaking. Leak was discovered coming from around internal valve. Contractor sent to attempt to tighten valve, but this did not work at it was found that it was coming from above that. Trailer was transloaded, and after inspection it was found to be an issue with a cracked weld in the barrel

item.title: Report X-2024110392
item.description:
Report X-2024110392

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-10
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WOODEN BOX WAS WET AND APPEARED TO HAVE LIQUID LEAKING OUT OF IT. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION PLASTIC PAIL INSIDE WAS MARKED WITH A LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND ON THE SIDE OF THE PAIL MAKING THIS AN UNDECLARED PACKAGE. THIS PRODUCT BARES TWO DIFFERENT COMPONETS THE SECOND COMPONENT IS ISOPHORONEDIAMINE, MIXTURE UN2289, 8, PACKING GROUP III. i HAVE EMAILED THE COMPANY FOR THE CORRECT MSDS.

item.title: Report E-2024110228
item.description:
Report E-2024110228

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 5, 2024, oen (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was damaged in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN3266-impacted impacted dock floor. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon lined poly drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110237
item.description:
Report E-2024110237

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: UNIONTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 15:37 PM ET, XAC contacted the call center to report a spill that was found inside of a trailer in Uniontown, OH. The spill consists of approximately 1 pint of All Purpose Clear Regular Bodied Low VOC Cement, which released from (1) 1 pint metal can due to a shipper loading error which caused the can to be damaged inside the box, spilling out onto the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with absorbents and place the contents into a 20-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2024110218
item.description:
Report E-2024110218

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-29
  • City: FRANKLIN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EnviroServe was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 8ft-by-50ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that fifty-five (55) gallons of material was released due to a defective metal drum. EnviroServe personnel used hand tools and absorbent rags to removed the solidified material. The recovered material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum and the defective drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the J.B. Hunt terminal pending profile approval.

item.title: Report E-2024110202
item.description:
Report E-2024110202

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-14
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:47 EST, ERTS was contacted by of XPO Logistics (XCN) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately .5 cup of Low Temp Draw Salt White (hazardous - UN1487) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. Terminal personnel advised they had the proper PPE, ventilation and poly drum to put product waste.

item.title: Report E-2024110190
item.description:
Report E-2024110190

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0254 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCO. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Meritech Boot Cleaner XP Solution was released from a 5-gallon plastic pail due to improper bracing and blocking by terminal BIN. The release impacted trailer #3212451. The spill was contained inside the box. Terminal Personnel placed the box into a 10-gallon metal drum.
